page.name: Additional Resources for using Moodle
page.content:
Moodle is an Open Source platform so documentation is created and updated by the Moodle community. You can view all of their documentation by going to: docs.moodle.org or, if you just want to learn more about specific Resources and Activities or other course management functions you can jump to docs.moodle.org/en/Managing_a_Moodle_course.

Moodle also maintains a YouTube channel which provides various explanations and tutorials at youtube.com/user/moodlehq. You can watch the LearnMoodle playlist below. clicking here.

For more information about the TEAL Lesson Plan Builder and the WIPPEA Model visit https://teal.ed.gov/tealGuide/lessonplanning

If you are unfamiliar with the ASSURE model there are numerous resources online. Search “ASSURE Model” in your favorite search engine to find immediate examples and references to how this is applied for selecting media materials for instruction. 

There are a number of Moodle hosting options for hosting your own course:

Hosting with your own organization: Many institutions host their own Moodle installation and teachers can restore backup copies of courses from other sites.

Self-hosting: Most web hosts offer one-click Moodle installation once you purchase a hosting package.

Moodle Partner Hosting: There are a number of Moodle partners that offer various hosting packages for organizations and individual instructors.
